cards.name: Aegis Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.flavor:
"We hold sacred the powers of light and life. Truth and honor are our greatest weapons."
—Alabaster creed
cards.name: Alabaster Mage
cards.text: {1}{W}: Target creature you control gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Angelic Destiny
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4, has flying and first strike, and is an Angel in addition to its other types.
When enchanted creature dies, return Angelic Destiny to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Angels appear before both the blessed and the cursed, though most don't know which they are until they feel either the angel's kiss or her sword.
cards.name: Angel's Mercy
cards.text: You gain 7 life.

cards.flavor: There are few things as satisfying as a good, healthy thunk.
cards.name: Arbalest Elite
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Arbalest Elite deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Arbalest Elite doesn't untap during your next untap step.

cards.flavor: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.
cards.name: Archon of Justice
cards.text:
Flying
When Archon of Justice dies, exile target permanent.

cards.flavor:
"When we of the Northern Verge claim a mount, no peasant's nag will do. It must be as strong as our virtue, and must join us of its own will."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge
cards.name: Armored Warhorse

cards.flavor:
"Griffins do not serve. They give freely to those they trust."
—Amira, skycaptain of Thune
cards.name: Assault Griffin
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "In memories, we can find our deepest reserves of strength."
cards.name: Auramancer
cards.text: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "One day I will rest and join my comrades in the afterlife, but not while scum like you still sully this world."
cards.name: Benalish Veteran
cards.text: Whenever Benalish Veteran attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"A world without evil? Boring. Give me vile fiends to smite and banish any day."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge
cards.name: Celestial Purge
cards.text: Exile target black or red permanent.

cards.name: Day of Judgment
cards.text: Destroy all creatures.

cards.flavor: Behind every mage is a trail of shattered lies.
cards.name: Demystify
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: With an armory of light, even the squire may champion her people.
cards.name: Divine Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Divine Favor enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.

cards.flavor: The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.
cards.name: Elite Vanguard
Gideon Jura
cards.text:
+2: During target opponent's next turn, creatures that player controls attack Gideon Jura if able.
−2: Destroy target tapped creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon Jura becomes a 6/6 Human Soldier creature that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

cards.flavor: "The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."
cards.name: Gideon's Avenger
cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on Gideon's Avenger.

cards.flavor: "The essence of a lawful society is swift deterrence."
cards.name: Gideon's Lawkeeper
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: "Your superstitions and mumblings are useless chaff before my righteousness."
cards.name: Grand Abolisher
cards.text: During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.

cards.flavor: After fighting alongside the griffin riders, older knights of Thune learned to admire a mount that could rip an enemy to shreds in seconds.
cards.name: Griffin Rider
cards.text: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.

cards.flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.
cards.name: Griffin Sentinel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor: A dozen fighting for each other are worth a thousand fighting for themselves.
cards.name: Guardians' Pledge
cards.text: White creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
cards.name: Honor of the Pure
cards.text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.
cards.name: Lifelink
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: "Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."
cards.name: Mesa Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard
cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: A griffin is not just an eagle's wings and a lion's claws. It is also the fiercest of hearts.
cards.name: Peregrine Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor:
"There is a place deep within my soul where no foe can intrude and no tyrant can conquer."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge
cards.name: Personal Sanctuary
cards.text: During your turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

cards.flavor: "Any hotheaded cub can raise a sword in anger."
cards.name: Pride Guardian
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Pride Guardian blocks, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: A thin shell lies between the roc and a world of bite-sized treats.
cards.name: Roc Egg
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Roc Egg dies, put a 3/3 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Follow the light. In its absence, follow her.
cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:
"The walls of the wicked will fall before us. Ready the siege engines. We proceed to war!"
—General Avitora
cards.name: Siege Mastodon

cards.flavor: The shield of unimpeachable purity is as strong as any wrought on the anvil.
cards.name: Spirit Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has protection from creatures.

cards.name: Stave Off
cards.text: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It did not escape the ambassador's notice that the sound of war drums could also marshal the city to attention.
cards.name: Stonehorn Dignitary
cards.text: When Stonehorn Dignitary enters the battlefield, target opponent skips his or her next combat phase.

cards.flavor: Its hooves touch the earth only when a hero must rise.
cards.name: Stormfront Pegasus
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: A blazing sun that never sets.
cards.name: Sun Titan
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Sun Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may return target permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The gods are not always kind, but they do have a soft spot for plucky underdogs.
cards.name: Timely Reinforcements
cards.text: If you have less life than an opponent, you gain 6 life. If you control fewer creatures than an opponent, put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "The universe is my instrument, and the song I play upon it is one you are forbidden to hear."
cards.name: Æther Adept
cards.text: When Æther Adept enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: She lures victims with promises of flesh, captures them in a net of deceit, and destroys them in the embrace of the sea.
cards.name: Alluring Siren
cards.text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.

cards.flavor:
"The amphin have long built their society in secret. While surface dwellers squabbled over trivial borders, they patiently expanded, building their ammonite temple-caves. Now amphin priests eye the shore, and amphin hunters gird for war."
—Gor Muldrak, Cryptohistories
cards.name: Amphin Cutthroat

cards.flavor:
"It was too fast, even for our veteran archers. They might as well have been blowing it kisses."
—Vulok, elvish archer
cards.name: Aven Fleetwing
cards.text:
Flying
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor:
"We draw our power from the infinite ocean of the mind, where all manner of things can be conceived."
—Azure creed
cards.name: Azure Mage
cards.text: {3}{U}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Belltower Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source deals damage to Belltower Sphinx, that source's controller puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor:
"Once he's got you, hold on. Fall from a drake and you'll suffer much worse than a bruise."
—Garl, drake trainer
cards.name: Chasm Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Chasm Drake attacks, target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.
cards.name: Coral Merfolk

cards.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Djinn of Wishes
cards.text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

cards.flavor:
"Is cold merely the absence of heat, or a force unto itself? Would a display of its power help you decide?"
—Zubarek, Icewinder Magus
cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.

cards.flavor:
"Those who claim to know the world in its entirety rarely have the requisite perspective."
—Ulmarus the Wise
cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.flavor: If you have to be stuck somewhere for a while, it's better to be stuck there with a friend.
cards.name: Frost Breath
cards.text: Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Frost Titan
cards.text:
Whenever Frost Titan becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays {2}.
Whenever Frost Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, tap target permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Like most giant monsters villagers worship as gods, it proves a fickle master.
cards.name: Harbor Serpent
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Harbor Serpent can't attack unless there are five or more Islands on the battlefield.

cards.name: Ice Cage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

cards.name: Jace, Memory Adept
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card. Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
0: Target player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
−7: Any number of target players each draw twenty cards.

cards.flavor: "This is a sacred duty. Master Beleren's trust has bought an eternity of my loyalty."
cards.name: Jace's Archivist
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.

cards.flavor: "You should try to clear your mind of idle thoughts. And if you can't, I will."
cards.name: Jace's Erasure
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, you may have target player put the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: "Why fight over scraps of land when there's so much sky waiting to be claimed?"
cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.

cards.flavor: "The dream does not end until I say so."
cards.name: Lord of the Unreal
cards.text: Illusion creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.flavor: Possession is ten-tenths of the law.
cards.name: Master Thief
cards.text: When Master Thief enters the battlefield, gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Master Thief.

cards.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor:
"Don't you think if I saw a half-woman, half-fish with three glowing eyes, I'd have remembered?"
—Drugo, town guard
cards.name: Merfolk Mesmerist
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Every primitive mind has a motive. Easy to find, and eminently exploitable."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage
cards.name: Mind Control
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: The creations of the hand are confined by reality. The creations of the mind know no such limits.
cards.name: Mind Unbound
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a lore counter on Mind Unbound, then draw a card for each lore counter on Mind Unbound.

cards.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.
cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.flavor:
"You know it to be false, but when its claws find you, what you know won't matter much at all."
—Pol Jamaar, illusionist
cards.name: Phantasmal Bear
cards.text: When Phantasmal Bear becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: Its hunger and ire are no less for being wrought of lies and mist.
cards.name: Phantasmal Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Phantasmal Dragon becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Phantasmal Image
cards.text: You may have Phantasmal Image enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it's an Illusion in addition to its other types and it gains "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

cards.flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
cards.name: Ponder
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"It's actually quite simple, but since you've only recently begun to walk upright, it may take some time to explain."
—Jace Beleren, to Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Redirect
cards.text: You may choose new targets for target spell.

cards.flavor: It's so light and fragile that it can glide where the air is thinnest.
cards.name: Skywinder Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Skywinder Drake can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Sphinx of Uthuun
cards.text:
Flying
When Sphinx of Uthuun enters the battlefield, reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Any oaf can conquer a kingdom. It takes true power to conquer time."
—Shai Fusan, archmage
cards.name: Time Reversal
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library, then draws seven cards. Exile Time Reversal.

cards.flavor: "Ribbit."
cards.name: Turn to Frog
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.

cards.flavor:
"It's nothing personal. I'd just prefer if you weren't."
—Ashurel, voidmage
cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"The past is the foundation for all that exists in the present. We merely reconstruct what our ancestors have already discovered."
—Sachimir, Sage of Memories
cards.name: Visions of Beyond
cards.text: Draw a card. If a graveyard has twenty or more cards in it, draw three cards instead.

cards.flavor: A drop now is all he needs to find you later.
cards.name: Blood Seeker
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may have that player lose 1 life.

cards.name: Bloodlord of Vaasgoth
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
Whenever you cast a Vampire creature spell, it gains bloodthirst 3.

cards.flavor: The most genteel facades hide the most abominable desires.
cards.name: Bloodrage Vampire
cards.text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"When you find yourself teetering on the edge of oblivion, mine will be the hands taking pleasure in giving you the final push."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Brink of Disaster
cards.text:
Enchant creature or land
When enchanted permanent becomes tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Call to the Grave
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a non-Zombie creature.
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Call to the Grave.

cards.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.
cards.name: Cemetery Reaper
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.
cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor:
"You clerics brag about your strength of spirit, yet I take away the tiniest fragment, and you crumple like a rag doll."
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

cards.flavor: When he began to curse what he held holy, his strength grew unrivaled.
cards.name: Dark Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Dark Favor enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.

cards.flavor:
"Let the final vision of doom be etched upon their unblinking eyes."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.

cards.flavor: Their arrival is heralded by the deafening hum of ten thousand wings. Their departure is marked by the silence of the dead.
cards.name: Devouring Swarm
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Devouring Swarm gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.
cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Disentomb
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Of course I'm sure I've gone mad. The little man who crawled out of my eye was quite clear on this."
cards.name: Distress
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: It stalks the fens by the light of the full moon, gathering shadows as it floats among them.
cards.name: Drifting Shade
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Drifting Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The swamps go silent at its approach, but it still hears the heartbeat of the prey within.
cards.name: Duskhunter Bat
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Flying

cards.flavor: Death in form and function.
cards.name: Grave Titan
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever Grave Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: His grim ritual ushers the dead to their new life.
cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Seeing you cower before me is its own reward."
cards.name: Hideous Visage
cards.text: Creatures you control gain intimidate until end of turn. (Each of those creatures can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor: Not every thought is a good one.
cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor:
"What do vermin cling to when all hope is lost?"
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Monomania
cards.text: Target player chooses a card in his or her hand and discards the rest.

cards.flavor:
"We wield death and darkness, powers that make lesser mages tremble in fear."
—Onyx creed
cards.name: Onyx Mage
cards.text: {1}{B}: Target creature you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: An assassin is a king's most trusted courier, ensuring his messages are heard by even the most unwilling recipients.
cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: The litany of the infernal on his flesh pulses to the beating of his dark heart.
cards.name: Rune-Scarred Demon
cards.text:
Flying
When Rune-Scarred Demon enters the battlefield, search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.
cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.flavor: Take away a few things, and a rebellion may ensue. Take away everything, and the oppression will be accepted as fate.
cards.name: Smallpox
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Sorin Markov
cards.text:
+2: Sorin Markov deals 2 damage to target creature or player and you gain 2 life.
−3: Target opponent's life total becomes 10.
−7: You control target player during that player's next turn.

cards.flavor: "All your steel won't protect you if your will is weak."
cards.name: Sorin's Thirst
cards.text: Sorin's Thirst deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: "Cherish these last moments. Though your miserable life has come to nothing, I have given it a magnificent end."
cards.name: Sorin's Vengeance
cards.text: Sorin's Vengeance deals 10 damage to target player and you gain 10 life.

cards.name: Sutured Ghoul
cards.text:
Trample
As Sutured Ghoul enters the battlefield, exile any number of creature cards from your graveyard.
Sutured Ghoul's power is equal to the total power of the exiled cards and its toughness is equal to their total toughness.

cards.flavor:
"How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads, to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula
cards.name: Taste of Blood
cards.text: Taste of Blood deals 1 damage to target player and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.
cards.name: Tormented Soul
cards.text: Tormented Soul can't block and can't be blocked.

cards.name: Vampire Outcasts
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Vengeful Pharaoh
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Whenever combat damage is dealt to you or a planeswalker you control, if Vengeful Pharaoh is in your graveyard, destroy target attacking creature, then put Vengeful Pharaoh on top of your library.

cards.flavor: Ghouls are often found skulking on the fringes of great battles, showing themselves only to snatch the wounded and weak, dragging their victims screaming into the shadows.
cards.name: Warpath Ghoul

cards.flavor:
"Don't blame me. You're the one walking around with skin."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.name: Wring Flesh
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.name: Zombie Goliath

cards.flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.
cards.name: Zombie Infestation
cards.text: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Blood Ogre
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: One thing's for sure—his fists are harder than your skull.
cards.name: Bonebreaker Giant
Chandra, the Firebrand
cards.text:
+1: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
−2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
−6: Chandra, the Firebrand deals 6 damage to each of up to six target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: Chandra never believed in using her "inside voice."
cards.name: Chandra's Outrage
cards.text: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Chandra's Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Whenever an opponent is dealt damage by a red instant or sorcery spell you control or by a red planeswalker you control, return Chandra's Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Which do you think is a better deterrent: a moat of water or one of fire?"
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Circle of Flame
cards.text: Whenever a creature without flying attacks you or a planeswalker you control, Circle of Flame deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Combust
cards.text:
Combust can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Combust deals 5 damage to target white or blue creature. The damage can't be prevented.

cards.flavor:
"We wield the fires of rage. War is our blood and destruction our birthright."
—Crimson creed
cards.name: Crimson Mage
cards.text: {R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor: There's nothing more exciting than a game of fetch the still-beating heart.
cards.name: Fiery Hellhound
cards.text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.flavor: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.
cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: He marks his territory with fire and wrath, etching the mountainside with his charring breath.
cards.name: Flameblast Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Flameblast Dragon attacks, you may pay {X}{R}. If you do, Flameblast Dragon deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: About halfway to the target, Snukk vowed that he had been tricked for the last time.
cards.name: Fling
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Careful. A drop of blood here means death for us all."
—Kalek, mountain guide
cards.name: Furyborn Hellkite
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 6 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying

cards.flavor: With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
cards.name: Goblin Arsonist
cards.text: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Bangchuckers
cards.text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Goblin Bangchuckers deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If you lose the flip, Goblin Bangchuckers deals 2 damage to itself.

cards.flavor: "It's time for the ‘Smash, Smash' song!"
cards.name: Goblin Chieftain
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.

cards.flavor: A rock between your eyes hurts. A burning rock between your eyes ruins your whole day.
cards.name: Goblin Fireslinger
cards.text: {T}: Goblin Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Don't underestimate the aerodynamic qualities of the common goblin.
cards.name: Goblin Grenade
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin.
Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.
cards.name: Goblin Piker

cards.flavor: "The best way over the mountain is through."
cards.name: Goblin Tunneler
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor:
"The secret to our war paint is hot peppers and stinkbugs. Lots of stinkbugs."
—Skab, goblin secretkeeper
cards.name: Goblin War Paint
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
cards.name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
cards.text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: "Fools dig for water, corpses, or gold. The earth's real treasure is far deeper."
cards.name: Grim Lavamancer
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Grim Lavamancer deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Spontaneous combustion is a myth. If you burst into flame, someone wanted you to."
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Inferno Titan
cards.text:
{R}: Inferno Titan gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Inferno Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: It can chop down a redwood in a single stroke. Your sternum isn't going to fare any better.
cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.flavor:
"Oh, it's easy enough to kill, but I'm not going anywhere near it."
—Norin the Wary
cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.
cards.name: Manic Vandal
cards.text: When Manic Vandal enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: For every action, there is a swifter and more violent reaction.
cards.name: Reverberate
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: Sometimes a little chaos is in order.
cards.name: Scrambleverse
cards.text: For each nonland permanent, choose a player at random. Then each player gains control of each permanent for which he or she was chosen. Untap those permanents.

cards.flavor:
"The beauty of it is they never see it coming. Ever."
—Razzix, sparkmage
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: It's rather embarrassing to end up with your head mounted over his hearth.
cards.name: Slaughter Cry
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: Blood is holy to those whose god is War.
cards.name: Stormblood Berserker
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor:
"You will kneel before me, even if I have to split the earth under your feet!"
—Ash Kronor, Keldon warlord
cards.name: Tectonic Rift
cards.text: Destroy target land. Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: Sometimes an eruption in Shiv produces something more dangerous than a mere river of molten rock.
cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor: The foolish try to leap through the unlit spaces. The arrogant believe the fires harmless. The wise find a different door.
cards.name: Wall of Torches
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.flavor: "Listen to the roar! Feel the thunder! The Immersturm shouts its approval with every bolt of lightning!"
cards.name: Warstorm Surge
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Acidic Slime
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Arachnus Spinner
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Tap an untapped Spider you control: Search your graveyard and/or library for a card named Arachnus Web and put it onto the battlefield attached to target creature. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.name: Arachnus Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
At the beginning of the end step, if enchanted creature's power is 4 or greater, destroy Arachnus Web.

cards.flavor: The rustling of leaves and a passing shadow are a dryad's only trace.
cards.name: Autumn's Veil
cards.text: Spells you control can't be countered by blue or black spells this turn, and creatures you control can't be the targets of blue or black spells this turn.

cards.flavor:
"The gods used their feathers to paint all the colors of the world."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur forest
cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"When we fail to see the beauty in every tree, we are no better than humans."
—Saelia, elvish scout
cards.name: Bountiful Harvest
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

cards.flavor:
"Tell the cooks to prepare the fires. Tonight we feast!"
—Tolar Wolfbrother, Krosan tracker
cards.name: Brindle Boar
cards.text: Sacrifice Brindle Boar: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Carnage Wurm
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Cudgel Troll
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Cudgel Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor: What's scarier than one of every beast in the forest?
cards.name: Doubling Chant
cards.text: For each creature you control, you may search your library for a creature card with the same name as that creature. Put those cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: All the trees of the forest are his army, and every leaf his shield.
cards.name: Dungrove Elder
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Dungrove Elder's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.

cards.flavor: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.
cards.name: Elvish Archdruid
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

cards.flavor: It's hard enough to find your way through uncharted wilderness when you can see the tip of your nose.
cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Garruk, Primal Hunter
cards.text:
+1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
−3: Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
−6: Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield for each land you control.

cards.name: Garruk's Companion
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Garruk's Horde
cards.text:
Trample
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may cast the top card of your library if it's a creature card. (Do this only any time you could cast that creature card. You still pay the spell's costs.)

cards.flavor:
"The wild is always changing, but it does have a few constants."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: "The forest is my cover and I hold it close. In such a tight embrace, there is no room for wickedness."
cards.name: Gladecover Scout
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: Bone, stone . . . both taste the same to a hungry basilisk.
cards.name: Greater Basilisk
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor:
"The predator knows the true way of the world. Life is conflict. Only the strong survive."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Hunter's Insight
cards.text: Choose target creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player or planeswalker this turn, draw that many cards.

cards.flavor:
"We are one with the wild things. Life blooms from our fingertips and nature responds to our summons."
—Jade creed
cards.name: Jade Mage
cards.text: {2}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible.
cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Lurking Crocodile
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor:
"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: When nature calls, run.
cards.name: Primeval Titan
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Primeval Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may search your library for up to two land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Primordial Hydra
cards.text:
Primordial Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, double the number of +1/+1 counters on Primordial Hydra.
Primordial Hydra has trample as long as it has ten or more +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.
cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.flavor: "Dance, and bring forth the coil! It is an umbilical to Gaea herself, fattening us with the earth's rich bounty."
cards.name: Rites of Flourishing
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
Each player may play an additional land on each of his or her turns.

cards.flavor: The only honey it wants is the sweet nectar flowing through your veins.
cards.name: Runeclaw Bear

cards.flavor:
"I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string."
—Aref the Hunter
cards.name: Sacred Wolf
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Skinshifter
cards.text:
{G}: Choose one —
• Until end of turn, Skinshifter becomes a Rhino with base power and toughness 4/4 and gains trample. Activate this ability only once each turn.
• Until end of turn, Skinshifter becomes a Bird with base power and toughness 2/2 and gains flying. Activate this ability only once each turn.
• Until end of turn, Skinshifter becomes a Plant with base power and toughness 0/8. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: The quickest way to get through the jungle is to agitate a rhino and run in its wake.
cards.name: Stampeding Rhino
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.flavor: The juiciest prey is that which grows lazy, thinking itself beyond the reach of danger.
cards.name: Stingerfling Spider
cards.text:
Reach
When Stingerfling Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.
cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Trollhide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}{G}: Regenerate this creature." (The next time the creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor: The gorger's insect-like eyes pick up the slightest movement in any direction. Its body then whips toward its prey with startling speed, swallowing it in one engulfing gulp.
cards.name: Vastwood Gorger

cards.flavor: Such loyalty can only be made.
cards.name: Adaptive Automaton
cards.text:
As Adaptive Automaton enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Adaptive Automaton is the chosen type in addition to its other types.
Other creatures you control of the chosen type get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The angel represents divine perfection; even the smallest feather is imbued with beauty and benevolence.
cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"With this crown, assert your authority."
—Crown inscription
cards.name: Crown of Empires
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature. Gain control of that creature instead if you control artifacts named Scepter of Empires and Throne of Empires.

cards.name: Crumbling Colossus
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
When Crumbling Colossus attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"If there is a fire that never ceases to burn, it surely lies in the maw of a dragon."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Druidic Satchel
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. If it's a land card, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
"Bottled life. Not as tasty as I'm used to, rather stale, but it has the same effect."
—Baron Sengir
cards.name: Elixir of Immortality
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 5 life. Shuffle Elixir of Immortality and your graveyard into their owner's library.

cards.flavor: The only blow that matters is the killing blow.
cards.name: Greatsword
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
"To my sword I owe my glory, but to my shield I owe my life."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge
cards.name: Kite Shield
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+3.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: It's seen the wonders of entire worlds trapped in the depths of a bottomless ocean.
cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unknowingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.
cards.name: Manalith
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Pentavus
cards.text:
Pentavus enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Pentavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Pentavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{1}, Sacrifice a Pentavite: Put a +1/+1 counter on Pentavus.

cards.flavor: Those who examine the amulet too closely have been known to become part of its ornate carvings.
cards.name: Quicksilver Amulet
cards.text: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: It has to deliberate a moment on the best way to break your face.
cards.name: Rusted Sentinel
cards.text: Rusted Sentinel enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor:
"With this scepter, smite your enemies."
—Scepter inscription
cards.name: Scepter of Empires
cards.text: {T}: Scepter of Empires deals 1 damage to target player. It deals 3 damage to that player instead if you control artifacts named Crown of Empires and Throne of Empires.

cards.name: Solemn Simulacrum
cards.text:
When Solemn Simulacrum enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
When Solemn Simulacrum dies, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Sundial of the Infinite
cards.text: {1}, {T}: End the turn. Activate this ability only during your turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack. Discard down to your maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

cards.name: Swiftfoot Boots
cards.text:
Equipped creature has hexproof and haste.
Equip {1}

cards.flavor: The golems of the ancient Thran still draw power in ways that baffle the artificers of today.
cards.name: Thran Golem
cards.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

cards.flavor:
"With this throne, unite your nation."
—Throne inscription
cards.name: Throne of Empires
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield. Put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead if you control artifacts named Crown of Empires and Scepter of Empires.

cards.flavor:
"If that is what you seek, try looking in craters."
—Fodrus, mastersmith
cards.name: Worldslayer
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, destroy all permanents other than Worldslayer.
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Jevna Nor lugged it around, bragging of his triumph over the wurm. Luckily, the tavern regulars didn't notice it was only a baby tooth.
cards.name: Wurm's Tooth
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: History has buried its treasures deep.
cards.name: Buried Ruin
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Buried Ruin: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Dragonskull Summit
cards.text:
Dragonskull Summit enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Drowned Catacomb
cards.text:
Drowned Catacomb enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Glacial Fortress
cards.text:
Glacial Fortress enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or an Island.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rootbound Crag
cards.text:
Rootbound Crag enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Forest.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sunpetal Grove
cards.text:
Sunpetal Grove enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or a Plains.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
